name: Crowne Plaza Amsterdam City Centre

reviews.text: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza Amsterdam City from 3-6th May, 2007. This hotel has a great location and is less than 5 minutes walk from Central Station.
reviews.title: Location Location Location....

likes.liked: — Fantastic location, large room and friendly staff.

reviews.text: Decided to cash in on priority club points and stayed in a two bedded queen room. As a platinum member of priority club this hotel allows access to the club lounge. The club lounge offers a selection of soft drinks, beer, wine and snacks throughout the day and is open from 07:00-24:00 daily. The lounge also has 2 PCs with free internet connection. A continental breakfast is served from 07:00 until 11:00 during the week and is extended until 11:30 at weekends.
reviews.title: Second to none!!!

likes.disliked: — I would have liked to stay longer!

reviews.text: Had a meal at the resaurant Dorrius within the hotel which was an excellent experience, typical dutch food and very good service.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff at this hotel were all polite, informative and helpful.
reviews.title: Great stay
Pleasant Stay
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel.

Without a doubt the best hotel we have ever stayed in, I have stayed in 4 star hotels all over the world and this hotel stands out on its own. The staff are very friendly and helpful creating a great athmosphere at all times, the bedrooms are excellent with all facilities at hand and cleanliness is exquisite! Location is perfect for the business traveller or the tourist. The restaurants are excellent delicous food in particular their dutch menu and finally the Breakfast wow! Buffet style breakfast with plenty of choice always served hot and again the service is of a very high standard... Definitely highly recommended if you are staying in Amsterdam!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel.....
Great Location
reviews.text: Just stayed at the Crowne Plaza Hotel, City Centre, Amsterdam for 4 nights. Opted for a club room, which gave you complimentary use of the minibar (wine, beer and soft drinks only excluded spirits and snacks), and free in room films. Also included full access to the club lounge located on the top floor, with great views over Amsterdam and great sunsets on a clear day. Again snacks and drinks are free, open 7am through to midnight. You also have your complimentary continental breakfast in the lounge.

reviews.title: Fair Service
reviews.text: There is also a very sweet little guest who lives in the lounge, you'll recognise him if you see him!

reviews.title: Not an ounce of fresh air!!!
reviews.text: I booked this through Hotels as the rate was much better than the hotel was offering if you booked direct. The hotel is set right in the heart of the city 10mins gentle walk from Central Station, so don't bother with a cab. The concierge was very good, really new his stuff and gave us a few good tips. Some entrance tickets are cheaper if you buy them from the hotel than the venue itself.
Only thing I didn't like was that the hotel room was really warm, even with the thermostat turned right down and you couldn't open the windows.
reviews.title: Quiet, not too expensive and friendly

reviews.text: A lovely well appointed hotel with excellent service and friendly staff. The location is fantastic and the hotel is hard to fault with spacious and comfortable public areas and lovely rooms with all the amenities you need. I really enjoyed my stay here and highly recommend this property to others. The only down side was no wi fi in room and huge price fluctuations from night to night. Breakfast was delightful - fresh, appealing and vast range of food groups to choose from. The conceirge staff were fabulous - very helpful and accomodating.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: I stopped over in Amsterdam for one night and decided to stay at the Crowne Plaza. The location is great since it's not on a busy street but yet is close to almost everything. The central station is a block away and there is a tram that runs along the street in front of it. The checkin person was a great help. After a quick checkin, she was more than happy in showing me the area on a map. I asked her for some recommendations on where to eat and she gave me some great suggestions. Instead of pointing me to the hotel restaurant she showed me places around the area. The room was spacious, quiet, and up to date. Couldn't complain at all. The fitness center was on the basement floor and was sufficient. I had a car and the cost to valet was not bad compared to other places I've stayed at if you are a priority club member. I'd definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Had a great stay

reviews.text: My husband and I had a very brief stay, arriving by train at 9 pm and leaving for a meeting the next morning. The hotel is a short walk from the Central Station. As a Priority Club Platinum member, we received an upgrade to a nice Excecutive corner room free internet access, and drink coupons. We had an excellent dinner in the restaurant, enjoying the delicious and very reasonable "October Menu." The room service breakfast the next morning was very good. When we come back to Amsterdam, we will definitely plan to stay at the Crowne Plaza.
reviews.title: An excellent one-night stay

reviews.text: I have stayed here a few times and being just a few hundred yards from the train station, the location is great. Modern, with great well equiped bathrooms its a pleasure to stay here. However price fluctuates enormously so can go from good value to over priced within a day or so.
reviews.title: great location, modern, spotless but bit pricey

reviews.text: Aother negative is the lack of wifi throughout and the exorbitant online charges in the room. Hotels of this calibre should provide free wifi throughout - its essential when on business. They dont charge extra for hot and cold running water - so why for internet.
reviews.title: Solid Business Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed in the crown plaza after a terrible night in another hotel and must say my husband and I had a very plesent stay. The room was large and very clean and had all the usual trimmings you would expect. We would with out a doubt stay here again.
reviews.title: Had a nice stay

reviews.text: The hotel is in a great area and very central and clean. I am sure the front rooms are a bit noisey, but we had a back room, away from the passing trams. The food/drink in the hotel is very expensive. The breakfast is 22 euros, but because i'm a gold member, i got it for 11. The food was great though. ONLY complaint - THE RUDE STAFF. Well particualarly, two women there, one being the boss and her subordinate. They were both rude and crass and disrespectful. I tried to complain, but the guess what, it's the boss who's rude to me, so who am i going to complain to!? I had to end up writing ic hotels themselves. Other than that, great hotel. Oh, one more thing, there are rats around... i was using the internet and one ran right behind the computer across the table! EEEEEWWWWKKKKK.
reviews.title: Matildas!

reviews.text: Hotel is in great location - moments from Central Station, and easily walkable to all main tourist sites. Plenty of restaurants and shops around, and tram stop just outside.
reviews.title: Great location but rooms could do with refurbishment
Perfect for Business Travelers
reviews.text: Rooms ok - but not 4 star (certainly not 5 star). 2 double beds for our family of 4 were fine - room not too cramped. Clean, but old furnishings - beds beginning to sag, and bathroom in need of refurbishment (eg peeling paint on radiator). Bath robes provided - but had seen better days, and towels very thin and worn. Windows did not open - but air conditioning fine - and no smells!

reviews.title: Very Central
reviews.text: Communal areas (lobby, restaurants) pleasant - breakfast good but not cheap (Euros 22 - but helped that children eat free) - ate out for other meals.

reviews.title: Enough said
reviews.text: A personal view

We had stayed at this hotel on dozens of occasions in the early 90's. In fact, at that time it was one of our favourite hotels and could easily hold it's own with other 'superior' hotel in Amsterdam - but not any more.
reviews.title: Just ok..

reviews.text: What has changed? Well, with two notable exceptions the answer is absolutely nothing whosoever.
reviews.title: The worst hotel in Amsterdam

reviews.text: The whole place is still stuck in an 80's time warp. It is bland, characterless and depressing with a decor that would not look out of place in a brown on beige 80's Colombo movie.
reviews.title: Great hotel......but upgrade your room !!

likes.liked: — The room and the club lounge

reviews.text: The bedrooms are depressing and unimaginative (don't go there for your honeymoon) - did I say depressing again.
reviews.title: Great location, but bad view

reviews.text: We stayed here over the Easter weekend as a family of 3 with a 10 year old. I was on crutches so had to be as near to transport as possible. The nearby tram. bus and canal bus stops took us to all the major attractions with ease. Central Station is only a short walk away too. We booked a club room and to be honest it just seemed like a standard roon to us. It was a bit small - everytime I sat in one of the armchairs I hit my head on the lamp. It was comfortable and fairly clean (bathroom needs a refurb as a bit grubby here and there). We loved the Club Lounge and went there every evening to relax and play chess or scrabble. The free mini-bar was never replenished unless we asked. The staff were friendly and fulfilled our requests, but really this should be done automatically - or why bother booking a club room. My son and husband used the pool, but said it was very small and got too busy to use at times. As a 4 star hotel it is not the best we have stayed in, but for friendliness and location it is hard to beat.
reviews.title: Friendly hotel, fantastic location

reviews.text: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 2 weeks in April. The hotel is standard at best, but does have a good location. The desk staff is continually bewildered when asked about the surrounding area (i.e. - "Where is a good place to go for lunch?" Enter a blank stare here....). Breakfast was included, and is pretty good. Besides the standard fare, there is a chef who prepares pancakes, waffles, omelets, etc. The rooms are predictably small, and stuffy. I stayed in a standard room, with no view or windows that opened. The decor and bathroom are in need of an update. The lighting is poor; even with all of the lights on it still seems like you are lighting the room with one 40 watt bulb. The location is a short walk from the train station, and close to many good restaurants and attractions. Overall, would probably look for another hotel in the same area if I return.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Our accommodation was excellent. We had a club room which was on special internet offer rate on the website. With a club room you get free breakfast, free minibar, extra free stuff in the room, your own dedication check-in desk, free wifi, reduced rate on the valet parking, free bar, free easter eggs for the kids etc. The service was top quality. Everyone really nice and friendly. The place was spotless - obviously just been done up. Not cheap, but one of the best business class hotels I've ever stayed in. Thoroughly recommended. Great location too.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: We stayed for four nights as a family of four, with the children (aged 4 and 6) sharing for free in a room with two double beds. The room was clean and functional. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. We did not eat at the hotel and so cannot say anything about the food quality (there is an abundance of restaurants within a short stroll that are fun to explore and mostly child-friendly) . The pool (if a little small) was a great attraction for the children and a great way to relax after a days touring in amsterdam. The location was fantastic being adjacent to major roads, the central station, tram lines and major shopping and other key attractions. Amsterdam is quit compact and easy to find you way around. We contempated staying outside and travelling in each day but our stay at the Crowne Plaza convinced us that staying in the heart of the city was the right option! The pool was the cherry on the cake. If you have young children, you will be glad to know that the hotel is sufficiently distant from the red light district and there are no overt shopfronts etc. nearby which would lead you to having to answer awkward questions! Enjoy!
reviews.title: Fantastic location

reviews.text: My two girlfriends and I stayed here for 3 nights on a trip for my birthday. First of all, this hotel is in a great location. We felt safe, and enjoyed the hotel's many amenities. When we arrived we found out that we needed a "white card" to recieve the family and friends discount (as one of my companions works for a hotel in the same brand). We arranged to have it emailed over and it was all taken care of within 24 hours of our arrival. Our room was not ready so the manager sent us over to the hotel bar to enjoy a few Heinekens while we waited. We had hardly gotten halfway into our beers when we were informed our room was ready and our bags had been taken up already. The pool was a great way to relax after our arrival and the room was quite large and comfortable. The housekeeping was immaculate and whenever we needed anything the staff was right on top of it. Don't listen to negative reviews...What a great hotel!
reviews.title: Wonderful!
great location
reviews.text: Good location, spa facilities on site, and a very nice club room (not sure if it is worth the extra fee, but it certainly came in handy). We'd stay here again.

After traveling through Europe, the Crowne Plaza was supposed to be the highlight of our trip (At least it was the most expensive hotel!). We checked in to find out that the hotel was oversold, as it turned out to be the busiest weekend of the year. As the front desk scrambled to find a room for us, they asked us if we would take a smoking room. I agreed to it only if we were in a room with windows that opened because my son has asthma. After much searching, the gentleman found us a nonsmoking room, but it wouldn't be ready for an hour. We went to have a late lunch and then came back and checked in. The first thing I noticed when I opened the door was a the overpowering smell of cigarette smoke. I double checked that the door does say "nonsmoking" on it. I called down to the front desk, but as they were overbooked, they couldn't move me. However, they did offer to either come up with a machine that removes the smoke from fabric or to spray air freshener. I decided that I didn't want to hang out in the room waiting, so I refused. I never got used to the smell, though, and regretting not taking them up on it. Coming out of the shower and putting a smokey towel up to my face turned my stomach. The room was okay, like any other American chain hotel. I did find the beds to be extremely comfortable, though. The location is great and the staff was always helpful. I tried the buffet breakfast on the last day and, while it was very good, it was very, VERY, expensive! There are other hotels that I would stay at before "splurging" on the Crowne Plaza again. It was definitely a disappointment.
reviews.title: A smoke filled disappointment!

reviews.text: Myself and my Husband stayed here in Sept 2004 for two nights the staff were lovely the hotel was lovely although the rooms a bit small, we had a very enjoyabel stay at the Crowne Plaza. It was very handy for Centraal Station, and althogether near most things
reviews.title: Fantastic Amsterdam!!!

reviews.text: After having just spent a week at the wonderful Mandarin Oriental in Kuala Lumpur, I'm ready to throw rocks at the CPCC in AMS. I took my wife with me for a conference in AMS. I have to agree with Chicago on the need for fresh air in the room - the stale cigarette smell was annoying. I think I'm going through nicotine withdraw from all of the 2nd hand smoke permeated in the walls and air ducts. There is no such thing as a non-smoking room in Europe. The room also needed some updating and there was mold on the grout in the bathroom. We won't even mention the cigarette burns in the carpet and bedding. My wife and I were trying to get over a little jet lag on the first afternoon, but we couldn't get a wink with all the banging and drilling coming from the service room next door. The concierge staff were cordial, but the hotel staff in the halls and elevator could not be troubled to say hello. Keep in mind I'm still spoiled from Malaysian hospitality. For the money (the conversion doesn't help), I expected a lot more from a 4 star hotel. You know a hotel isn't living up to its former glory when the latest entry of autographed head shots on the walls in the bar is David Lee Roth with his big 80's hair saying how much he enjoyed his stay...in 1990.
reviews.title: Ditto on the fresh air

reviews.text: Rooms were small and noisy. Well equiped but standard room. I stay a lot at crown plaza hotels but this one is below average. breakfast was excellent and location is ok.
reviews.title: This is not what I expect booking a Crown Plaza

reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located, close to easy transportation and major city center attractions. The central station is within 5-10 min walk, where frequent trains take you to Schiphnol in 15 min. Walking distance to the dam, red light district, and other major attractions (Anne Frank House for example is 15 min away). Yet hotel is not right at the attractions as some other hotels so has less noise and traffic (still facing a major road and easy to find).
reviews.title: Location location location

reviews.text: I was in a clubroom facing the courtyard and heard no noise at all. A glass table in the middle separates the room into roughly a living area (with a sofa, a coffee table and an armchair) and a sleeping area (a king size bed). I believe this room type is shown in one of the photos on their website and found it inconvenient - this setting forced me to use the glass table in the center of the room but it is too small and my chair cannot move around (it is locked on one side by another desk and at the other side by the coffee table). In room coffee and tea selections are plenty, with a tea kettle and a fancy coffee maker that uses small coffee packets. I was offered a one-package daily rate of around 28 euros for internet (20 euros daily if charged separately) and movies,and would probably accept it if my room rate did not include the internet already.
reviews.title: One of the simplest and classiest hotels I have visited so far

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff is more than friendly. The concierge desk is very helpful in providing all sorts of information and advice. Was greeted every time I entered the hotel or in the hallway. Club lounge on the ground floor is large and provides adequate contiental breakfast with yogourt and cold meat such as salami and turkey. During the day cookies and some small bites are provided.
reviews.title: Just Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was a guest at the Crown Plaza City Center in Amsterdam in September 2011. Just before that I was a guest in a Crown Plaza in Antwerp, Belgium. I still have the perspective of the Crown Plazas between two different countries and I have to say there are some big differences.
reviews.title: Just perfect

reviews.text: 1- Hotel In General
reviews.title: Peaceful
A welcome retreat
reviews.text: We stayed at the Crown Plaza hotel several weeks ago having left another hotel (Prinzhendrik) due to their refusal to move us to a quiet room and total indifference...its along story.

reviews.title: Central Location & Good for Family of Four
reviews.text: As we were already in Amsterdam we were able to see several hotels first hand. Most that seemed reasonable were full....others were very high in price. We knew that we wanted to stay around the area where the CP was. We were looking for 2 adjacent rooms and were able to get a reasonable price - not much more than the previous. Another review commented on the breakfast price. If you order in advance you can get at 16euros and also...kids are free. So what did we get?? Everything we wanted. A quiet night sleep, good location, robes, good b'fast. etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: when i go to Amsterdam,i like to stay as close as possible to DAM.We arrived at 7 am and our check-in time was at 2 pm.we were so tired .it fair to say that the staff were very understanding and allowed as a room at 9 am,thanks to them.however,the queen bed was small.
reviews.title: back to Amsterdam

reviews.text: I stayed 3 nights in late September as part of a business trip. This hotel is very centrally located, only minutes from the Centraal station, right along a tram route. However, I walked everywhere, even as far as to Rembrandt’s house. The room was exceptionally comfortable, a good size for single person, very well equipped with everything one can ask for. I especially appreciated having a hot water heater and assortment of instant coffee, hot cocoa, and teabags. I really appreciated the pair of slippers provided as I like to take my shoes off for comfort but do not like going barefoot. I even brought my own pair from a previous hotel stay, which I left behind since the pair from Crowne Plaza was much more comfortable! I ate breakfast one morning at the hotel restaurant, which offered a very good buffet, but was rather shocked by the price after wards (didn’t check the price in advance). I needed to have a good breakfast before the meeting, so it was worth it as part of a business trip. All in all, I had excellent stay there, and was very comfortable.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, close to everything

reviews.text: We enjoyed a three night stay at the Crowne Plaza in early October 2011. The hotel registration staff is very friendly and accommodating, especially as we arrived in mid-morning. Our room was quickly made ready for us and luggage transported to our room cheerfully and efficiently.
reviews.title: Very nice Amsterdam hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is ideal for exploration of Amsterdam. This was our first visit to the city and the concierge provided maps and advice on how to locate sites of historic or cultural interest. We also were given information on nearby restaurants, which turned out to be excellent dining experiences. At our depature, the concierge made taxi arrangements to Schipol as well as provided advice on travel times.
reviews.title: Short break in the city of canals

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was nicely equipped with comfortable beds and an adequate sized bathroom. Although the shower controls were a bit difficult to figure out and operate, the water pressure and temperature were excellent. The room temperature controls worked very well. Coffee and tea are available in the room and ice machines are close by on each floor. The hotel is quiet. Access to elevators is controled by the room "key-card."
reviews.title: Nice stay in Amsterdam

reviews.text: We stayed the Crowne Plaza Amsterdam City for 2 nights 03rd - 5th September. We booked two rooms as we took my parents over for a short break.
reviews.title: Crowne Plaza Amsterdam City - Much improved!!
Great - No smell of smoke and has air conditioning!
reviews.text: Prior to booking in February, we looked at Tripadvisor and saw some very mixed reviews. Some were good, but most found fault with the staff and general standard of decor / bathrooms within the hotel. Being Priority Club members and regular contributors to sites such as this, we wrote to the hotel and asked for their comments in response to the previous negative reviews. We received an immediate response from the reservations manager who addressed each of the issues in turn and explained that by the time we arrived in September most (if not all) problems would be resolved. We got the opportunity to book our room at a discount rate on the IC web site so thought we would take a chance.

reviews.title: good location
reviews.text: Upon arrival, we were greeted by an efficient concierge who took all our luggage and escorted us through to check in. The desk staff were friendly and helpful. Once I had introduced myself, I was reffered to by name (as all priority club members should be) and the whole check in procedure was seemless and simple. We arrived at our rooms to find the luggage inside and waiting.

We booked superior club rooms and found both rooms to be clean, well presented and spacious (by Amsterdam standards). Both rooms had windows that opened and we had no smoke related problems that others seem to have experienced.
reviews.title: loved the crowne plaza

reviews.text: Our deal included free minibar (less spirits) and access / use of the club lounge facilities. We had a super breakfast out on the club lounge terrace on the 6th floor overlooking the city and found the continental breakfast selection to be more than adequate.
reviews.title: Great experience!

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for three nights with a group of friends. It was ideally placed for sightseeing around the city, whether it was the museums you were interested in or the red light district (but it was far away enough if you didn't want to venture near the red light district!)
reviews.title: Quality service...

reviews.text: The hotel staff were superb and could not be faulted for their friendliness and helpfulness.
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found everything clean and met our needs, however the decor etc did need a slight facelift. Security also seemed good, when returning after hours they requested you to show your door card to cctv camera. Although the method seems quite easy to get round if unwanted people did try to enter, it is more than most hotels do to try and prevent unwanted guests.
reviews.title: club rooms not worth the extra money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, value for money and well located, well recommended.
reviews.title: Needs some work

reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed in the Crowne Plaza in the centre of Amsterdam over the New Year period. The hotel is very central - a 5 minute walk from Central Station and also Dam Square. Everyone was very friendly and our room was clean and warm! Great place for Amsterdam sights but rather expensive :-(
reviews.title: A well sited functional business hotel

reviews.text: Spent one night in Amsterdam with some old friends - we wanted somewhere very central but not right in the red light district.
reviews.title: Did the job!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CP is ideal for that - in fact it's location is it's biggest asset. It is a comfortable hotel, reasonably priced and well maintained. But it wont win any awards for creativity or hospitality. It's a standard, "much what you would expect" kind of place - but it did the job!
reviews.title: Time for a spruce-up

likes.liked: — Convenience for tram stops and train station
likes.disliked: — Didn't quite live up to promise of CP website

reviews.text: Intercontinental really need to dig deep into their pockets to ensure this Crowne Plaza's interior matches the quality and enthusiasm of their staff.
reviews.title: Great stay at Crowne Plaza

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The public areas are in fairly good repair, but the rooms? If ours was typical, it's probably a good two years past being due a decoration.
reviews.title: Central location nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had ordered a non-smoking room, but didn't get one - we asked at reception and were given the impression that guests didn't overmuch pay any attention to the non-smoking rules anyway; the bathroom had a fairly strong smell of dried urine about it and the windows didn't open, all of which added up to a room that could have done with a bit of an airing.
reviews.title: Typical city centre hotel.
central and handy
reviews.text: This hotel is only a short walk from Centraal station and provides a very comfortable accomodation with an excellent restaurant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was upgraded on both of my visits to this hotel which made my stay even more comfortable.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - Enjoyed Our Stay - Highly Recommended

likes.disliked: — The fact we couldn't book in when we arrived early

reviews.title: Lovely central location
reviews.text: Rooms are above average for space and are well appointed.
We came to Amsterdam for our first anniversary.
reviews.title: Crowne Plaza -Couldn't Provide

reviews.text: The Crowne Plaza was a lovely relaxing hotel with excellent room service, a nice quiet bar and restaurant and a buffet breakfast second to none. The breakfast is "all you can eat" and has a large variety of fruits, cerials, yoghurts, pastries and breads plus the cooked section. Wonderful, and breakfast is open from 06:30 to 11:00 hours so there is plenty of scope for those early risers and those lazy snoozers, such as ourselves. The pool in the hotel is cool and relaxing and there are saunas in the changing rooms. With internet access also, the hotel truly was a fantastic place to stay.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but overpriced and fake wine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were hesistant to book at the Crowne Plaza because of past reviews about noise but we never heard a thing at night. The location was very convenient - within walking distance of all of the sights and restaurants. The concierge was very helpful in making reservations. After living and traveling in Europe for the hottest summer on record - the air conditioning was pure bliss. Our only problem was being placed in a smoking room - but the smell was not too strong. All in all - the hotel looks a little worn but it is a good value.
reviews.title: Good value for the price and location.

likes.liked: — location and good air conditioning in Europe!!!

reviews.title: Not a 4 star hotel
reviews.text: This is the third time I have stayed in this hotel. It is not a 4 star hotel, maybe a 3. The rooms are small and outdated but adequate. If you can get a room facing an alley, they are relatively quiet. The rooms this visit were not exceptionally clean, with dirty grout, and I had to change from my first room as the bathroom toilet had not been cleaned well. The second room was fine. The breakfast is not worth the price.

reviews.title: looking tired
reviews.text: I would look for a better hotel next time. Unfortunately, my company keeps booking travelers here because it is central and cheaper prices can be booked on the internet.
The lobby is dark, tired looking and outdated. The staff is pleasant.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: I stayed here for 1 night on the club floor. I booked through ichotels web site and asked for a king bed. Check in was a bit slow but i was upgraded to a kind of suite. This had a hall, bedroom and tiny living room with gravel balcony. The decor was early 80's and not that well maintained,stained walls from water seepage, battered paintwork and the tiles around the bath had holes for old fittings drilled and just left making it look a bit dirty. A nice touch is the senseo coffe maker in place of the usualinstant sachets. The club lounge is pleasant enough for a drink but didn't eat anything there. For the 180 euro i paid i guess it is ok for this city but i would pay the usually higher prices
reviews.title: Great Location
A strong 4-star hotel.
reviews.text: Be advised that the windows in the room are sealed shut.

reviews.title: okay
reviews.text: I have just returned from AMS where it was snowing, blowing, and freezing cold. However, my room was so hot and stuffy that I had no occassion to turn on my heat.

reviews.title: Grand Central Spot
reviews.text: Used priority club points to stay here first weekend in July. We wanted to see and experience Amsterdam and were only in our hotel to sleep at night, and catch 40winks in the afternoon.
Very contented with the hotel. Room was large and clean, as was the bathroom with ample toilteries, coffee making facilities, iron, hair dryer etc. all as expected.
reviews.title: a total gem

likes.liked: — the hospitality, housekeeping promptness,the breakfast and restaurant DORRIUS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet breakfast in the lounge was adequate, as was the gym, however the pool was a little cold - but was empty when we went to it. Also very small, not long enough for laps and no jacuzzi.
reviews.title: Not a great hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is tucked in by central station, so very convenient for the airport, but a little quieter that street front locations. Tram is easily accessed at the front door to take you to Liedseplein (sp??), Anne Frank and Van Gough Museum area. Its a short walk to the red light and shopping areas with many little restaurants along the way.

reviews.title: Great hotel - great city - love the place
reviews.text: Consierge Staff are very helpful in advising tickets and attractions and don't rip you off.
Great location, full hotel amenities, and a spacious & cosy room. Do we need more? Yes, free-wifi internet, but in these bailout days, cheap daily rates are welcome.
reviews.title: A right place to stay in Amsterdam

reviews.text: The hotel is placed just a five-minute walk from the Central station, and has a great location if you want to discover Amsterdam. Even if it is centrally located, I found it to be quiet, and the sleep quality was very good! This, of course, also do to the great beds. Nice touch with the lavender-spray to spray on your pillow at bed time. My room (which was an executive room with lounge access) was large, and tastefully furnished. Bathroom facilities also very good. The lounge was also good, so was the breakfast. All in all, a good hotel to stay in, and if I go to Amsterdam again, I will definitely consider staying there again.
reviews.title: Great location, good room

reviews.text: I loved everything about this hotel. The location is fantastic (just a 5-10 minute walk from Centraal Station), the rooms are wonderful (with British outlets and American outlets on the desk), and the breakfast buffet is plentiful (but overpriced). However, the best thing about this hotel is its staff. Every single person I encountered was welcoming, professional and friendly.
reviews.title: PERFECT!

reviews.text: We got to the hotel before the official check in time, and they couldn't have been more apologetic that my room wasn't ready. Obviously, I understood and was happy to wait. They were able to have a room for me a couple of hours after I arrived (and was still able to check in before the regular check in time). The concierge is knowledgeable and helpful. The bar and restaurant members of the staff are also friendly.
